Q1: If you provide a Point-to-point transport service as a driver, you must ___
A1: Consume food and smoke in your car
A2: Challenge passengers to complain against LTA
A3: Start an argument with a passenger

Q2: Who regulates the fare structure for taxi services?
A1: Land Transport Authority (LTA)
A2: Union
A3: Public Transport Council (PTC)

Q3: Which of the following is part of the Code of Conduct for Point-to-Point transport operator?
A1: To dress professionally, in collar shirt, tailored pants and covered shoes
A2: To be friendly, courteous, and helpful
A3: To smile and practise safe driving habits always

Q4: Which of the following is the attribute of a street-hail and a ride-hail driver?
A1: I provide service to all passengers, regardless of their race, language or religion
A2: I will challenge my passengers to a fight who argue with me
A3: I will speed to get to the destination
A4: I will comply with all traffic rules only when enforcement officer is present

Q5: What do you understand by the term 'a street-hail service' in Singapore?
A1: A service where flagging down a taxi at a taxi stand is allowed
A2: A service where flagging down a taxi at a bus-stop
A3: When booking of taxi is only by using a mobile app
A4: When you can book a taxi by calling a Private Hire Car operator number

Q6: If one of the tyres of your Taxi is blown out, what must you do?
A1: Sit in the car and wait for help.
A2: Call upon other car drivers to help you.
A3: You must change it even if you do not know how to do it.
A4: Change the tyre if possible. If not, seek help by calling the Automobile Association or get help from other taxi drivers.

Q7: How do you keep clean your taxi or private hire car?
A1: Wash and clean the car exterior
A2: Wipe clean and sanitised the car interior
A3: Clear all wastes in the car to ensure it is free of cockroaches and ants

Q8: What are the guidelines to be followed to ensure the safety of the passengers?
A1: Slow down and drive carefully over the road tumps. Do not overtake
A2: Inform passengers that they must wear safety belt for their safety
A3: Do not carry more passengers beyond what is allowed in your vehicle

Q9: Which is NOT an occupational health hazard to a Taxi driver?
A1: Pain to backbone, neck, or head
A2: Fatigue and stress
A3: Sleep deprivation (lack of sleep)

Q10: Which of the following are symptoms of diabetes?
A1: Frequent urination, thirst, and hunger
A2: Blurred vision
A3: Numb or tingling in hands or fest

Q11: Which of the following aid in avoiding collision with vehicle ahead?
A1: Staying alert
A2: Keep a safe distance from the vehicle ahead
A3: Do not tailgate the vehicle in front of you

Q12: Which of the following should be done if an accident causing injuries happens?
A1: Do not panic.
A2: Call the Police at 999 or 995 for ambulance
A3: Inform your operator company and the insurance company of the accident within 24 hours, or by the next working day

Q13: For a street-hail or a ride-hail driver, fatigue can lead to
A1: Driver becoming more alert and drive carefully
A2: Driver falling asleep at the wheel and resulting in road accidents.
A3: Lowering body stress and anxiety

Q14: Who is responsible for the passenger's safety in the taxi or private hire car?
A1: The passenger
A2: The driver
A3: Service provider operators

Q15: What should you do when your vehicle has broken down or stalled?
A1: Move it to the road shoulder if possible
A2: Switch on the hazard lights
A3: Place the breakdown-warning triangle at least 20m behind the vehicle

Q16: What is the first thing you must do if a passenger has fainted in your vehicle?
A1: Carry the passenger out of your car
A2: Drive your car to the side of the road and call your operator company
A3: Help to revive the passenger with medical oil
A4: Search the body of the passenger for a handphone to call his or her family.

Q17: According to LTA's IVRD (in-vehicle recording devices) guidelines, the driver is NOT allowed to use ___ for personal gain.
A1: The communication between passengers talking in the car
A2: Recorded video and audio of passengers
A3: The photo of passengers

Q18: In communicating with the passenger, the driver should _____
A1: Sense the need to talk to the passenger
A2: Keep on talking and explaining
A3: Show gestures as much as possible
A4: Turn his head behind and talk to passenger all the time

Q19: What should you do when you notice your passenger is on a wheelchair?
A1: Just ignore it and do nothing
A2: Pretend you didn't see it
A3: Get out of the car and offer your help
A4: Tell the passenger not to take your vehicle.

Q20: What should you say/do with the change after you have collected cash payment from a passenger before he alights from the taxi?
A1: Keep the change quietly
A2: 'Sir/Mdm, your change'
